title: EBT on DoorDash: Adding Your Card, Stores, Fees, & More

steps.title: Open your DoorDash profile.
steps.content: Open your DoorDash profile. Now that DoorDash accepts EBT at many grocery stores, it's easy to pay for grocery delivery with your SNAP benefits! You'll just need to add your EBT card to your payment profile first. Tap the outline of a person at the top-right corner of the DoorDash app to open your profile.

steps.title: Tap Payment.
steps.content: Tap Payment . This opens the Payment menu, where you can add your EBT card and other payment methods. While you can use EBT to pay for grocery items on DoorDash, it won't cover fees, tips , restaurant orders, or non-food items. If you haven't already added another payment method, you'll be prompted to do so during checkout to cover these costs.

steps.title: Select SNAP/EBT Card.
steps.content: Select SNAP/EBT Card . This option is under "Program Cards." If you see a pop-up window explaining that your EBT card can only be used to buy groceries at eligible stores, tap Got it , then tap SNAP/EBT Card again.

steps.title: Enter your EBT card number.
steps.content: Enter your EBT card number. Your EBT card number is typically on the back of the card. Tap Save to save your card, and enter your PIN if prompted. Now that you've added your EBT card to DoorDash, you're ready to shop!

steps.title: Shop at a participating retailer.
steps.content: Shop at a participating retailer. When browsing DoorDash stores, look for the ones labeled "SNAP." DoorDash accepts EBT in most states at Acme, Albertsons, Aldi, King's, Meijer, Pavilions, Safeway, Shaws, Star Market, Vons, and some (but not all) 7-Eleven locations. [1] X Research source You can use EBT at any of these retailers to pay for uncooked groceries like vegetables, fruit, meat, dairy, snacks, pantry staples, and non-alcoholic beverages. [2] X Research source If you're viewing the details of an EBT-eligible item, you'll see SNAP on its product page. Heated/hot foods and cold prepared foods are not SNAP eligible. [3] X Research source You can add non-EBT items to your cartâ€”the cost of these items will be billed to your default payment method.

steps.title: Select Pay with SNAP at checkout.
steps.content: Select Pay with SNAP at checkout. After reviewing your DoorDash cart, you'll see this option on the checkout page. This will display your SNAP balance and show you the total amount of all EBT-eligible items in your cart. If you haven't already done so, you may be prompted to enter your 4-digit EBT PIN to display your balance. If you don't see this option, EBT is not accepted at this location.

steps.title: Enter the amount you want to pay and tap Continue.
steps.content: Enter the amount you want to pay and tap Continue . You can enter the entire SNAP-eligible subtotal if you have enough benefits on your EBT card. You can also pay for just a portion of your groceries with EBT and save the rest for your credit or debit card. Remember, you'll need another payment method added to DoorDash to cover fees and non-eligible items.

steps.title: Tap Place Order to confirm.
steps.content: Tap Place Order to confirm. If you don't have another payment method added, you'll be prompted to add one first. Any items and fees not covered by EBT will automatically be billed to your alternative payment method.
